page.title: 04Normanby Hall Country Park 2
page.content: The gardens and grounds around Normanby Hall have been developed as a Country Park covering some 168 acres of wooded parkland. There is an aviary housing British and exotic birds.Part of the wooded parkland is a deer park and there are several very different nature trails designed by a Countryside interpretive service whose staff are available to help visitors.There is a pottery and a Smithy where work can be seen in progress and purchases made. The Park is the venue for many people particularly at weekends when there is usually a local band playing.The Park is also used by camping and caravanning clubs who hold rallies there.Horse riding events are also held in the Park and the Hunter Trials attract competitors from a large area.
